It analyzes various financial metrics like Acquirer's Multiple, Expected Return, Return On Assets, Incremental Growth, FCF Yield, and Shareholder Yield to assess its valuation and intrinsic value. The analysis suggests that based on these metrics, PG could be considered a great value stock.

title: Ashland Appoints Steve Bishop and Suzan Harrison as Directors
summary: Ashland Global Holdings Inc. has appointed Steve D. Bishop, former CEO of Procter and Gamble consumer health care, and Suzan F. Harrison, former president of Colgate-Palmolive global oral care, to its board of directors effective July 1, 2022. These appointments will temporarily expand the board from nine to eleven members, succeeding William Dempsey and Ricky Sandler who will not seek re-election in January 2023. Guillermo Novo, Ashland's CEO, expressed confidence that the new directors will bring valuable perspectives to the company's strategy and profitability.

title: P&G’s Marc Pritchard: ‘the industry has gone too far with purpose marketing’
summary: Marc Pritchard, chief brand officer at Procter & Gamble (P&G), suggests that some companies have over-leveraged purpose marketing to the detriment of brand growth, especially amidst inflation and the cost of living crisis. He argues that growth should be the primary focus for businesses, as it enables them to do good. Pritchard advises marketers to "double down" on product superiority and media spend, rather than cutting investment during economic pressures.

title: Carrier and P&G Join Forces to Create Healthier Homes
summary: Carrier and Procter & Gamble's Home Care brands are collaborating to promote healthier homes through education, innovation, and integrated solutions for improved indoor air quality and safety. This partnership aims to empower consumers with insights and products to tackle common household health challenges like dust accumulation and carbon monoxide safety. The initiative is expected to expand, focusing on consumer needs and behaviors related to total home health.

title: Procter & Gamble Partners With Microsoft To Transform And Accelerate Digital Manufacturing
summary: Procter & Gamble (P&G) has partnered with Microsoft to advance digital manufacturing through cloud, AI, and digital transformation technologies. This multiyear collaboration aims to make manufacturing smarter by utilizing Microsoft Cloud, Azure data, and AI solutions to optimize P&G's manufacturing and packaging processes, initially focusing on diaper and paper towel production. The initiative seeks to improve predictive quality, reduce downtime, enhance supply chain efficiency, and explore the concept of an "industrial metaverse" for simulating manufacturing environments.

title: P&G taps Microsoft for cloud services to boost production efficiency
summary: Procter & Gamble has partnered with Microsoft to utilize its Azure cloud computing services and predictive analytics to enhance manufacturing efficiency, reduce costs, and improve product delivery. This collaboration aims to leverage digital manufacturing visibility and advanced analytics to optimize production processes for various P&G products globally. The initiative builds on four years of prior cooperation, focusing on better data utilization, automation, digital twins, and sustainability.

title: Ingredion names VP, chief procurement officer
summary: Javier Echevarria has been appointed as the new vice president and chief procurement officer at Ingredion, Inc. In this role, he will oversee global procurement, supply chain operations, and strategic sourcing, reporting to Eric Seip. Echevarria brings extensive experience from VVF Americas, Glanbia, Avient Corp., and Procter & Gamble.

title: Edgewell debuts Gen Z-focused skincare brand, Fieldtrip
summary: Edgewell has launched Fieldtrip, a new clean skincare brand aimed at Gen Z consumers. The brand offers unisex products with luxury formulations under $25, initially sold direct-to-consumer and on Amazon, with plans to expand to Nordstrom and Macy's. Fieldtrip emphasizes sustainability and affordability, aligning with Gen Z's values.

title: P&G Announces a Water Positive Future Strategy: Our Vision to Reduce, Restore and Respond
summary: P&G has announced a comprehensive strategy for a "Water Positive Future" with the goal of restoring more water than it consumes in at-risk watersheds by 2030, including during consumer use of products in high water-stressed metropolitan areas. This initiative involves on-site water efficiency, long-term restoration projects in critical areas, and inspiring consumers to reduce their water footprint through product innovations and collective actions. The strategy is inspired by the legislative legacy of Virginie Helias's father, Jacques Oudin, who championed decentralized cooperation in water and sanitation.

title: P&G Levels Up Manufacturing With Machine Learning and AI
summary: Procter & Gamble is partnering with Microsoft to implement AI, machine learning, and edge computing across over 100 manufacturing sites globally to improve productivity, reduce costs, and increase consumer satisfaction. This multiyear relationship will leverage Microsoft Azure to digitize and integrate data, enabling real-time, data-informed decisions and innovations in areas such as energy use, downtime reduction, and product quality. The collaboration includes the creation of a Digital Enablement Office to incubate and deploy high-priority business scenarios.

title: Procter & Gamble’s CIO believes passion is contagious. His latest passion: digitally remaking the 185-year-old company
summary: Vittorio Cretella, CIO at Procter & Gamble, is leading a massive digital transformation of the 185-year-old company. P&G has partnered with Microsoft to leverage the Microsoft Cloud, aiming to accelerate its digital manufacturing platform and enrich the Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT). This collaboration seeks to improve productivity, speed up product delivery, boost customer satisfaction, and reduce costs, while also enhancing environmental sustainability through optimized energy and water consumption.

title: Inter Parfums, Inc.’s CFO Russell Greenberg to Retire After Over 30 Years of Service
summary: Russell Greenberg, the Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Inter Parfums, Inc., is set to retire on September 6 after over 30 years of service. He will be succeeded by Michel Atwood, previously the Vice President of Finance and Strategy at The Estee Lauder Companies. Greenberg will stay until September 30 to facilitate a smooth transition, and Atwood will also fill the board seat Greenberg vacates.
source: Happi | Household And Personal Products Industry
source_domain: Happi | Household And Personal Products Industry

title: Procter & Gamble is placing a big bet on the metaverse to support its suite of brands
summary: Procter & Gamble is dedicating significant resources to the metaverse to find new ways to interact with consumers and add value for them and retail partners. The company has used the metaverse to replicate industry events, launch virtual brand experiences including games, and promote sustainability efforts. While engagement has increased, P&G acknowledges the ultimate business value is still being determined, but sees it as a transformative platform for consumer engagement.

title: The 5 JUST 100 Companies Leading on Gender Board Diversity
summary: Despite women leaving the workforce at a higher rate during the pandemic, board leadership has seen gains in gender diversity. This article identifies five JUST 100 companies—General Motors, Citigroup, Procter & Gamble, Nielsen, and Merck—that lead in board gender diversity with 40% or more women on their boards and at least one female-chaired committee. It details how each company prioritizes gender diversity and ESG performance within their leadership structures.

title: Is Procter & Gamble a Climate and Rights Villain?
summary: The article accuses Procter & Gamble (P&G) of being a "climate and rights villain" due to its alleged involvement in deforestation, Indigenous land theft, and labor violations. It highlights P&G's continued sourcing from palm oil companies linked to destruction in crucial ecosystems like the Leuser Ecosystem and the use of forced labor, despite public and scientific consensus on environmental protection. The author urges consumers and investors to pressure P&G to stop sourcing from suppliers that destroy primary forests and protect communities.

title: Clorox Announces Appointment of Julia Denman and Stephanie Plaines to its Board of Directors
summary: The Clorox Company announced the appointment of Julia Denman and Stephanie Plaines to its board of directors, expanding the board to 13 members. Both Denman and Plaines bring extensive financial expertise and leadership experience from various sectors, enriching the board's diversity and qualifications. They are expected to serve on the audit committee, contributing to Clorox's strategic goals and stakeholder value.

title: New P&G distribution center will bring 350 new jobs to Butts County
summary: Procter & Gamble Distributing, LLC is investing $205 million in a new distribution facility in Jackson, Georgia, which is expected to create 350 new jobs in Butts County. Governor Brian Kemp announced the company's expansion, highlighting the focus on creating jobs in rural Georgia. The distribution center will be over 1 million square feet and will be a state-of-the-art, automated facility.

title: Rising fats and oil prices have Colgate-Palmolive looking to mitigate costs
summary: Colgate-Palmolive is facing "greater-than-expected" increases in raw material costs, particularly fats and oils, which have doubled since 2020 and are projected to rise an additional 60% year-over-year. The company is exploring mitigation tactics such as leveraging alternate materials and reformulating products to combat these rising costs, further exacerbated by the war in Ukraine and an Indonesian palm oil export ban.

title: Newell Brands Appoints President And CFO
summary: Newell Brands Inc. has appointed Chris Peterson as President and Chief Financial Officer, acknowledging his significant contributions to the company's turnaround and operational excellence. Peterson will continue to oversee financial operations, supply chain, IT, and real estate, reporting directly to CEO Ravi Saligram. This promotion recognizes his efforts in improving the company's balance sheet, reducing complexity, and driving profitable growth.

title: Newell Brands Names Chris Peterson President & CFO
summary: Newell Brands Inc. has appointed Chris Peterson as President & Chief Financial Officer, effective immediately. Peterson will continue to oversee financial operations, supply chain, IT, and related services, reporting to CEO Ravi Saligram. This promotion recognizes his significant contributions to the company's financial turnaround, operational excellence, and balance sheet strengthening since joining in 2018.

title: Heroes and Zeros: Eastman Chemical vs. Keurig
summary: This article contrasts Eastman Chemical's initiative to tackle single-use plastic waste with Keurig's misleading claims about the recyclability of its K-Cup pods. Eastman Chemical is investing in a $1 billion plant in France to convert plastic waste into new materials, while Keurig faced a $3 million penalty from Canada's Competition Bureau for greenwashing. The piece highlights the ongoing battle against plastic pollution and the need for genuine solutions versus deceptive marketing.

title: Makers of Dawn dish soap, Heinz ketchup, Clorox boost defenses against store brand rivals
summary: Brand-name product manufacturers like Clorox, Kraft-Heinz, and Procter & Gamble are increasing their defenses against store-brand rivals as consumers' budgets strain under persistent inflation. Companies are using tactics such as increased promotions, emphasizing product value, and launching innovative new products to maintain market share. This comes as Nielsen data shows that price hikes on private-label household goods have outpaced major brands, and consumers are increasingly opting for cheaper alternatives.

title: SEC concludes probe on PureCycle Technologies
summary: The SEC has concluded its investigation into PureCycle Technologies Inc. CEO Mike Otworth regarding statements about the company's technology, financial projections, and business plans, without taking further action. PureCycle, a plastics recycler specializing in polypropylene purification, stated its satisfaction with the outcome and reaffirmed its focus on company goals. This conclusion follows a previous subpoena to Otworth and questions raised by Hindenburg Research.

title: Procter & Gamble Co: Greater Disclosure of Material Corporate Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Data
summary: Shareholders are requesting that Procter & Gamble ("P&G") disclose quantitative data on workforce composition, recruitment, retention, and promotion rates by gender, race, and ethnicity to assess the effectiveness of the company's diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts. The resolution highlights how P&G is lagging behind its S&P100 peers in sharing such data, which is crucial for investors to evaluate human capital management and avoid the perception of performative DEI practices. P&G's Chief Brand Officer, Marc Pritchard, has acknowledged the importance of DEI to consumers and the potential for significant financial gain from multicultural consumers, further underscoring the need for robust internal data.

title: P&G makes the case for its premium products as consumer budgets battle shrinkflation and rising prices
summary: Procter & Gamble is emphasizing the value of its premium products amid high inflation and rising prices, countering consumer trends toward private-label brands. The company's CFO, Andre Schulten, highlighted their "superiority strategy" as a driver of strong market and share growth. This approach aims to convince consumers that the performance and quality of brands like Tide justify their cost, even as budgets are squeezed.

title: Analytics Unite 2022: Procter & Gamble's David Dittman Joins Loyalty Talk
summary: David Dittman, vice president and chief analytics officer at Procter & Gamble, will join the "Innovative Loyalty: Identify the Data that Creates Obsessed Consumers" session at Analytics Unite 2022. The event will focus on creating impactful loyalty strategies that strengthen existing consumer relationships and incentivize new customers. Dittman will share insights from his 12+ years of experience at P&G in leveraging analytics for marketing, product supply, and customer business development.

title: Procter & Gamble on scaling AI for enterprise
summary: Procter & Gamble's CIO, Vittorio Cretella, highlights four key pillars for scaling AI in enterprise: data, talent, platforms, and trust. P&G utilizes AI across its operations, from inventory monitoring (saving $60m annually) to product innovation and preventative maintenance. The company emphasizes consolidating data into a 10 Petabyte data lake, a balanced internal/external talent strategy, automated platforms for diverse use cases, and fostering trust in AI among middle management.

title: Procter & Gamble expects inflation to continue impacting profitability
summary: Procter & Gamble reported strong fiscal third-quarter earnings, beating projections due to price hikes on its brands despite facing significant commodity cost increases and supply chain disruptions. The company raised its 2022 revenue growth forecast but expects inflation to continue impacting profitability, hinting at further price increases. This strategy, while effective for now, is pushing consumers to consider cheaper alternatives, according to market research.

title: Procter & Gamble raises sales forecast as demand stays price resistant
authors: Jessica DiNapoli and Uday Sampath Kumar
summary: Procter & Gamble raised its full-year sales forecast due to stronger-than-expected consumer demand for cleaning and personal care products, despite higher prices. The company's sales growth is at its strongest in 15 years, driven by consumers switching to premium products, though P&G also announced fresh price hikes and warned of potential impacts on earnings per share due to higher costs and the Russia-Ukraine war. Net sales for the quarter ended March 31 beat analyst estimates, and the company adjusted its fiscal 2022 sales growth projection upwards.

title: Focus: Oreo-maker, Nestle, Pepsi face pressure from European employees over Russia
summary: Oreo-maker Mondelez, Nestle, and PepsiCo are facing significant pressure from their employees in Ukraine and Eastern Europe to cease all business operations in Russia following the invasion of Ukraine. Employees have expressed anger and even resigned over the companies' continued presence, citing concerns that tax and salary payments contribute to the Russian state budget. While the companies have made some adjustments, such as suspending advertising or certain product sales, workers are demanding greater transparency and a stronger stance against Russia.

title: P&G’s Duncan to Deliver 2022 Irwin Warren Lecture in Advertising and Digital Media
summary: Phil Duncan, chief design officer for Procter & Gamble (P&G), will deliver the 2022 Irwin Warren Lecture titled “Building Brand Experiences for the Future” at the University of Kentucky. The lecture, sponsored by the Department of Integrated Strategic Communication, will discuss transforming P&G’s product strategies into holistic consumer experiences and showcase Duncan's work with initiatives like the Olympic sponsorship. The event honors Irwin Warren, a notable figure in advertising, and provides students with insights from leaders in strategic communication.

title: P&G Ukraine Relief Efforts
summary: Procter & Gamble (P&G) is actively involved in extensive relief efforts for Ukraine, providing multimillion-dollar product donations of essential hygiene items and significant financial support to humanitarian partners like the Red Cross and Save the Children. P&G employees are also contributing personal time, housing, and transportation for refugees, while the company maintains an employee matching gift program to further aid those affected by the conflict. P&G's ongoing priorities include protecting its employees, maximizing product availability, and supporting communities and relief agencies.

title: Group Black, Inc. Secures 9-Figure Investment from Procter & Gamble
summary: Group Black Inc., a collective focused on Black-owned media companies, has secured a nine-figure media investment from Procter & Gamble. This investment is the largest single commitment the company has received and aims to advance its mission of building diverse Black-owned media businesses and addressing the lack of investment and opportunities in the sector. The partnership will help P&G diversify its media spending and connect with Black consumers, with initial activations including Charmin and Bounty at South by Southwest.

title: Consumer Staples: 5 Things To Know About This Defensive Sector
summary: This article provides an overview of consumer staples stocks, highlighting their defensive nature, consistent dividend payments, and potential drawbacks like modest growth and susceptibility to inflation. It categorizes consumer staples into five subcategories and explains how investors can gain exposure through individual stocks or ETFs. The piece emphasizes their stability during market volatility and their role as a cushion for investor portfolios.

title: MSG Entertainment Names Lucas Watson President, MSG Sphere
summary: Madison Square Garden Entertainment Corp. announced the appointment of Lucas Watson as President, MSG Sphere, effective March 28. In this role, Watson will lead the business strategy and execution for MSG Sphere, the company's planned immersive entertainment venues, including go-to-market planning and bookings. The first MSG Sphere venue is scheduled to open in Las Vegas in the second half of 2023, and Watson will also oversee the global development of the MSG Sphere brand.

title: P&G’s Plan to Get Into Prestige Beauty
summary: Procter & Gamble is re-entering the prestige beauty market seven years after selling off numerous beauty brands, launching a new specialty beauty division and acquiring brands like Tula, Farmacy, and Ouai. The company plans to leverage these acquisitions to expand its presence in the high-growth skin and hair care sectors, despite increased competition from other CPG giants and digital-native brands. P&G aims to support these brands with its R&D and marketing expertise while allowing them to maintain operational autonomy.

title: VP at Procter & Gamble shares advice with students in leadership course
summary: Jeanie Knuth, VP of Research & Development at Procter & Gamble and a Mizzou Engineering alumna, shared her insights on leadership and career development with students in the new Engineering Leadership and Strategic Communications course. She emphasized the importance of experiential learning, mentorship, and networking, crediting her own Mizzou experiences for her success. Knuth also highlighted her commitment to mentoring others, particularly those facing biases, and giving back to her alma mater.

title: Huggies Maker to Keep Selling Products in Russia
summary: Kimberly-Clark Corp., the maker of Huggies diapers, announced it will continue selling essential products like baby diapers and feminine pads in Russia, citing the humanitarian nature of these items. However, the company will halt capital spending and advertising in the country and has suspended investments in its Stupino, Russia, facility. This decision comes as other major consumer companies face pressure to cut ties with Russia following its invasion of Ukraine.

title: P&G announces new Specialty Beauty division
summary: Procter & Gamble has established a new Specialty Beauty division under its global P&G Beauty business to house high-end products. This new division will include recent acquisitions like Ouai, Tula Skincare, and Farmacy, as well as First Aid Beauty, and brands incubated in-house such as SeeMe Beauty and KeepItAnchored, alongside SK-II’s North American operations. P&G veteran Chris Heiert will lead the division, reporting to CEO Alex Keith.

title: P&G halts investments, cuts back product sales in Russia
summary: Procter & Gamble is reducing its operations in Russia by halting new capital investments, suspending advertising, and significantly cutting back its product portfolio to focus on essential health, hygiene, and personal care items. This decision comes in response to the war in Ukraine, with P&G also providing relief efforts and support for its employees in Ukraine. The company joins a growing list of global corporations scaling back Russian operations, though some consumer giants like Nestle and Pepsi have yet to follow suit.

title: Russian invasion of Ukraine: P&G halting Russian investment and advertising, cutting product offering
summary: Procter & Gamble announced it is significantly cutting back its product offerings in Russia, ceasing all new marketing and investment in the country due to the invasion of Ukraine. The company has also suspended operations in Ukraine and is providing extensive support to its employees there. P&G, which considers Russia one of its top-10 markets, is adjusting its operations while prioritizing employee safety.

title: Colgate-Palmolive Co. stock outperforms competitors despite losses on the day
summary: Colgate-Palmolive Co. (CL) stock experienced a 0.88% loss on Monday, closing at $76.68, amidst a broader market downturn where the S&P 500 fell 2.95% and the Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 2.37%. Despite this decline, Colgate-Palmolive's stock outperformed several key competitors, including Procter & Gamble Co. (PG), Unilever PLC ADR (UL), and Reckitt Benckiser Group PLC (RBGPF), which all experienced larger percentage losses. The stock closed $8.93 below its 52-week high reached earlier in January.

title: What impact will Ukraine crisis have on Procter & Gamble Co.?
summary: The article discusses the potential impact of the Ukraine crisis and Russian sanctions on Procter & Gamble Co., referencing past currency-related losses and P&G's current preparedness. While P&G's sales and profits from Russia and Ukraine are small, the economic slowdown in Europe could significantly affect P&G and other multinationals, prompting warnings to businesses about engaging with Russian entities.

title: Wide Moat Stocks Can Get Their Grooves Back
summary: The VanEck Vectors Morningstar Wide Moat ETF (MOAT) has shown durability amid market turbulence in early 2022 and is outperforming the S&P 500. Analysts believe wide moat equities have the ingredients for continued success, with the ETF's valuation methodology identifying stocks trading at attractive multiples despite their inherent quality. MOAT's sector-agnostic approach and diversified holdings, including non-tech stocks, are helping to buffer against current tech sector weaknesses.

title: Surabhi Pokhriyal Named Chief Digital Growth Officer at Church & Dwight
summary: Church & Dwight has appointed Surabhi Pokhriyal as its Chief Digital Growth Officer, where she will lead the company's digital transformation and e-commerce initiatives. Pokhriyal, previously with Colgate-Palmolive and other major consumer goods companies, is tasked with accelerating digital momentum, including e-commerce penetration and M&A integration. She is excited to leverage the company's nimble structure and focused talent to elevate its digital capabilities and expand its brand footprint.

title: Colgate® Launches its Groundbreaking Recyclable Toothpaste Tube with "Recycle Me!" Packaging in the U.S.
summary: Colgate is introducing its breakthrough recyclable toothpaste tube in the U.S., featuring "Recycle Me!" packaging to raise awareness. Made from HDPE, the same plastic as milk bottles, this new tube is designed to be recycled alongside plastic bottles without extra steps. Colgate-Palmolive is also collaborating with peer companies and recycling facilities to pilot educational efforts and define best practices for tube recycling.

title: Colgate-Palmolive Co. stock underperforms Tuesday when compared to competitors
summary: Colgate-Palmolive Co. (CL) stock underperformed on Tuesday, shedding 0.64% to $81.92, despite an overall favorable trading session for the broader market. The stock also closed below its 52-week high and displayed mixed performance compared to competitors like Procter & Gamble Co., Unilever PLC ADR, and Reckitt Benckiser Group PLC, all of which also saw slight declines. Trading volume for Colgate-Palmolive Co. exceeded its 50-day average.

title: ESG Risk Management Makes Sense, but ESG Impact Is Less Straightforward
summary: This article distinguishes between ESG risk management and ESG impact, arguing that while managing ESG risks directly affects valuation, measuring and achieving positive ESG impact is far more complex and less directly tied to financial returns. It highlights challenges companies like Unilever face when prioritizing sustainability impact at the expense of core business fundamentals, and discusses the difficulty in objectively measuring the benefits of impact spending and aligning diverse investor values.

title: Eastman unveils plans for $1B polyester depolymerization plant
summary: Eastman is planning to build a $1 billion polyester depolymerization facility in France to chemically recycle up to 160,000 metric tons of hard-to-recycle plastic annually. Several global brand owners, including Procter & Gamble and L'Oréal, have signed letters of intent to purchase the recycled resin. This investment, announced by Eastman CEO Mark Costa alongside French President Emmanuel Macron, marks a significant step in the company's circular economy strategy and will reduce its carbon footprint in Europe.

title: Mars taps former J.M. Smucker Co. executive to lead pet nutrition innovation
summary: Mars Petcare has appointed Alejandro “Alex” Cedeno as Senior Vice President of Research and Development for its Pet Nutrition North America team. Cedeno, formerly of The J.M. Smucker Company, will lead innovation aligned with Mars' commitment to pets and will replace Michel Oostwal, who is retiring. He will be responsible for strategic and operational leadership in R&D, focusing on food safety, sustainability, and product innovation.

title: More than words
summary: Plastic packaging producers worldwide are increasing investments to close the loop on their products, acknowledging the historically low recycling rates for plastic compared to other materials. These investments span various forms, from traditional scrap collection and processing to advanced recycling technologies, driven by regulatory pressure, corporate sustainability goals, and shareholder activism. The article highlights major players like Alpla Group, Amcor, Sealed Air Corp., Ineos Styrolution, and PureCycle Technologies, emphasizing efforts in PET, HDPE, and PP, and discussing the debate around the economic viability and environmental impact of chemical recycling.

title: Shun Concentration Risk With Equal-Weight ETFs
summary: This article discusses the increasing concentration risk in cap-weighted S&P 500 indexes due to the massive market capitalization of a few tech giants like Apple and Microsoft. It promotes equal-weight ETFs, such as the Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF (RSP), as a solution to this problem, highlighting their comparable performance with superior diversification. The piece draws historical parallels to the tech bubble, emphasizing the benefits of a less concentrated portfolio.

title: Shed Concentration Risk With Equal-Weight ETFs
summary: This article discusses the increasing concentration risk in cap-weighted indexes like the S&P 500, primarily due to the large market capitalization of a few tech giants like Apple and Microsoft. It advocates for equal-weight exchange-traded funds (ETFs), such as the Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF (RSP), as a solution to provide comparable returns with superior diversification. The article highlights how equal-weight ETFs mitigate the risks associated with an over-reliance on a few mega-cap stocks.

title: STEM Professionals Are ReLaunching Careers With P&G
summary: P&G's ReLaunch program is successfully bringing STEM professionals who have taken career breaks back into the workforce. The program, which started in 2020 and has expanded globally, offers flexibility and support, appealing to individuals seeking meaningful careers and work-life balance. It highlights how career breaks can bring valuable maturity and diverse experiences to companies.

title: Lawsuits mount against Procter & Gamble over cancer-causing chemical in Old Spice, Secret sprays
summary: Procter & Gamble is facing at least 17 federal lawsuits, including six class-action suits in Cincinnati, alleging its Old Spice and Secret antiperspirant sprays are contaminated with dangerous levels of benzene, a known carcinogen. These lawsuits follow a November report by Valisure, an independent lab, which found high levels of benzene in various body-spray products, prompting P&G to voluntarily recall several aerosol products. P&G states benzene is not an ingredient in their products but came from the propellant, and despite claims of low risk, they issued recalls "out of an abundance of caution."

title: Procter & Gamble recalls 32 dry shampoo and conditioner products over benzene concern
summary: Procter & Gamble has issued a voluntary recall for 32 of its dry shampoo and conditioner products, including brands like Pantene and Herbal Essences, due to the detection of "unexpected" levels of benzene, a known carcinogen. The company stated that it has not received any reports of adverse events and is conducting the recall out of an abundance of caution, offering reimbursement to consumers. This action follows recent reports of benzene found in aerosol products, with P&G identifying the carcinogen in the propellant used to spray its products.

title: P&G harnesses the power of partnerships to drive innovation and impact
summary: P&G is leveraging partnerships to achieve its net-zero greenhouse gas emissions goal by 2040, focusing on innovation in its Fabric and Home Care sector, particularly with its Tide brand. These collaborations, including with NASA and suppliers, aim to develop sustainable products and processes, reduce supply chain impacts, and drive consumer behavior change towards more environmentally friendly practices like cold water washing. P&G emphasizes that such partnerships are crucial for tackling the climate crisis and meeting consumer expectations for sustainable solutions.

title: Shampoo, conditioner recall: Procter & Gamble sprays could contain cancer-causing chemical
summary: Procter & Gamble is recalling several dry conditioner and dry shampoo aerosol products from brands including Pantene, Aussie, and Herbal Essence due to the detection of benzene, a cancer-causing chemical. The recall is voluntary and being conducted out of an abundance of caution, with P&G offering reimbursements to consumers. People are advised to stop using the products and dispose of them.

title: Procter & Gamble issues a recall on 32 hair care products on ingredient cancer concern
summary: Procter & Gamble issued a recall for 32 aerosol dry shampoos and conditioners due to the presence of benzene, a carcinogen. The recall affects popular brands like Pantene, Aussie, and Old Spice. Consumers are advised to stop using the products and can return them for a refund.

title: P&G recalls some conditioner, shampoo sprays on finding carcinogens
summary: Procter & Gamble Co (PG.N) has voluntarily recalled some dry conditioner and shampoo sprays from several brands, including Pantene and Herbal Essences, in the United States and Canada due to the detection of a cancer-causing chemical, benzene. While the company stated that daily exposure to the detected benzene levels is not expected to cause negative health consequences, the products represented less than 1% of its overall hair care portfolio. This recall follows a similar action earlier in the year by Johnson & Johnson, which also detected benzene in some of its sunscreen products.

title: Edgewell Personal Care Acquires Billie in $310 Million Deal
summary: Edgewell Personal Care has acquired the female personal care brand Billie in a $310 million all-cash transaction, significantly strengthening its position in the women's shaving category. This acquisition enhances Edgewell's digital capabilities and market presence while providing Billie with broadened retail distribution and marketing channels. The deal follows a previous attempt by Procter & Gamble to acquire Billie, which was blocked by the FTC due to antitrust concerns.

title: How Sumaira Latif brought accessible design to P&G
summary: Sumaira Latif, Accessibility Leader at Procter & Gamble, spearheaded efforts to integrate accessible design into P&G's products and packaging after realizing the challenges faced by disabled consumers, drawing from her own experience as a blind person. She initiated the People with Disabilities Network and the Disabilities Challenge to immerse colleagues in the realities of product accessibility, leading to innovations like tactile indicators on Herbal Essences bottles and the adoption of NaviLens QR codes on Pantene products. Latif advocates for industry-wide collaboration and the inclusion of disabled consumers in the design process, emphasizing that accessible design benefits everyone and presents a significant business opportunity.

title: Edgewell Personal Care acquires subscription-based body care brand Billie
summary: Edgewell Personal Care has acquired Billie Inc., a direct-to-consumer brand specializing in women's personal care products, for $310 million in an all-cash transaction. Billie, known for its subscription-based model and strong digital presence, generated $90 million in revenue last year and plans to expand into brick-and-mortar retail in 2022. This acquisition strengthens Edgewell's position in the women's shaving category and enhances its digital capabilities, following a previously blocked acquisition attempt by Procter & Gamble in 2020.

title: Edgewell Acquires Digital Native Billie
summary: Edgewell Personal Care Company has acquired direct-to-consumer personal care brand Billie for $310 million in cash, nearly a year after the FTC blocked Procter & Gamble's attempt to purchase the brand. Billie, a digitally native company, generated $90 million in revenue in 2020 by manufacturing women’s shaving and body care products. This acquisition is expected to enhance Edgewell's digital capabilities, a complement to their existing brands, and facilitate Billie's expansion into U.S. brick-and-mortar stores and new product categories.

title: Schick Owner Edgewell Personal Care Buys Women’s Razor Brand Billie
summary: Edgewell Personal Care, maker of Schick razors, has acquired women’s razor brand Billie for $310 million. This acquisition comes after federal regulators blocked a previous attempt by Procter & Gamble (Gillette's parent company) to acquire Billie due to antitrust concerns. Billie, founded in 2017, targets younger consumers with affordable products and campaigns that challenge traditional beauty standards.

title: Procter & Gamble Issue Voluntary Recall of Certain Old Spice, Secret Products
summary: Procter & Gamble has issued a voluntary recall of specific Old Spice and Secret brand aerosol antiperspirants and Old Spice Below Deck aerosol spray products due to the detection of benzene. This action follows findings by Valisure, a private pharmaceutical company, which identified benzene in various antiperspirant body sprays, leading to concerns about potential health risks despite no reported adverse events to date. The recall highlights broader issues concerning raw material quality and the need for independent testing in the consumer healthcare product supply chain.

title: Procter & Gamble Buys Farmacy Beauty
summary: Procter & Gamble has acquired Farmacy Beauty, a cult "farm-to-face skincare" brand, to expand its skincare portfolio and attract younger consumers. P&G aims to leverage Farmacy's science-based sustainable products and D2C presence, along with its existing retail channels like Sephora, QVC, and Amazon. The deal is expected to help Farmacy grow beyond its current $80 million net sales, with brand founder David Chung remaining as an advisor and Mina Chae becoming the new President and CEO.

title: Waldencast acquires beauty brands Obagi and Milk Makeup in three-way US$1.2 billion deal
summary: Waldencast, a special-purpose acquisition company, has acquired skincare brand Obagi and makeup and skincare company Milk Makeup in a three-way deal valued at US$1.2 billion. This acquisition is the first step in Waldencast's strategy to build a global multi-brand beauty and wellness platform. Michel Brousset, Founder and CEO of Waldencast, will lead the new entity, with Co-founder Hind Sebti serving as Chief Operating Officer.

title: Procter & Gamble to acquire Farmacy
summary: Procter & Gamble has reached a deal to acquire the indie skincare brand Farmacy Beauty. The deal terms were not disclosed, but Farmacy is expected to report net sales of US$80 million this year. Farmacy's founder emphasized the need for P&G's resources for further growth, while P&G highlighted the brand's science-backed and natural "farm to face" positioning.

title: Herbal Essences packaging incorporates Eastman Renew
summary: Herbal Essences is launching new product packaging made from Eastman Renew molecular-recycled plastic, becoming the first P&G brand to do so. This initiative leverages a collaboration between P&G and Eastman Chemical Co. to advance circular economy goals by reducing reliance on virgin plastic and encouraging recycling. The new packaging will feature How2Recycle labels and continue to be part of TerraCycle's national recycling program.

title: Clorox turns to contract suppliers, manufacturers to bolster inventory
summary: Clorox is increasing its reliance on third-party manufacturers and suppliers to meet high demand for its products, with contract manufacturers now handling approximately 50% of shipments, up from 20% historically. This strategy, while costly, helped Clorox avoid raw material shortages and rebuild inventory, positioning them well on supply. However, the company views these additional measures as temporary, planning to scale back and take manufacturing back in-house once demand stabilizes and they can find cost savings.

title: As General Electric splits apart, does GE Aviation become Greater Cincinnati's newest Fortune 500 company?
summary: General Electric is splitting into three stand-alone companies: aviation, healthcare, and energy. This move positions GE Aviation, based in Evendale, as a potential new Fortune 500 company for Greater Cincinnati, given its $22 billion in 2020 revenues. The split aims to provide stronger focus and better financial flexibility for each resulting business.

title: Cardinal Health is Ohio’s biggest company; what others make the top 10?
summary: The article highlights Ohio's largest companies based on the 2021 Fortune 500 list, with Cardinal Health securing the top spot. It details the top 10 companies, including their revenue, overall Fortune 500 ranking, headquarters, and number of employees. The report also notes changes from the 2020 list, such as companies joining or dropping off the Fortune 500.

title: 'Mr. P&G' takes over: Jon Moeller takes helm of company he helped rebuild
summary: Jon Moeller officially takes over as CEO of Procter & Gamble Co. on November 1st, having been a 33-year veteran of the company. His appointment on July 29th was met positively by investors, resulting in the share price reaching an all-time high. Moeller played a significant role in rebuilding the company, earning him the moniker "Mr. P&G."

title: a2 Milk and The Hershey Company to release co-branded chocolate milk
summary: The a2 Milk Company and The Hershey Company announced a partnership to release co-branded Hershey’s/The a2 Milk Company chocolate milk, scheduled to hit shelves in January 2022. This collaboration pairs Hershey’s iconic chocolate with a2 Milk's premium A2 protein milk, aiming to capture the market for natural, high-quality chocolate milk that may help avoid stomach discomfort. The initiative marks Hershey's first partnership with a premium milk company and is seen as an expansion into "better-for-you" categories.

title: Arm & Hammer, OxiClean parent plans price hikes
summary: Church & Dwight Co., the parent company of Arm & Hammer and OxiClean, is implementing price increases across 80% of its product portfolio to counter rising input and transportation costs. These hikes follow previous actions in July and October, with further increases expected in 2022 due to ongoing inflationary pressures. Despite a drop in gross margin caused by various cost factors, the company reported strong third-quarter profits and expects a positive full-year performance.

title: Diaper, Tissue, Toilet Paper Prices Likely to Rise, Kimberly-Clark Warns
summary: Kimberly-Clark, the maker of Huggies and Kleenex, has warned that prices for diapers, tissues, and toilet paper are likely to increase due to inflation and persistent supply chain issues. The Irving-based company also revised its annual earnings forecast downwards for the third consecutive quarter, citing a "volatile and difficult macro environment." This signals potential higher costs for everyday household products for consumers.

title: P&G shifts suppliers, product formulas to avoid supply chain issues
summary: Procter & Gamble is proactively addressing supply chain disruptions and inflation by utilizing alternate suppliers and reformulating products. CFO Andre Schulten stated that these strategies help optimize costs and maintain product availability without impacting quality for consumers. Other companies like Levi's are also employing global sourcing strategies to mitigate similar issues.

title: P&G: Marketing efficiency breeds effectiveness, leading to more investment
summary: Procter & Gamble plans to maintain current marketing investment levels, aiming to support growth as consumers favor trusted brands. The company focuses on marketing efficiency through digital reach and better targeting to offset increased costs, with e-commerce now contributing 14% of total sales. P&G's strategy has resulted in strong sales, partially due to investments in digital marketing, helping it gain market share amidst rising prices and supply chain challenges.

title: Procter & Gamble says it's raising prices on some grocery items
summary: Procter & Gamble announced its latest round of price increases on certain grooming, beauty, and oral care products for retail customers, effective in the next 90 days. This decision is driven by higher costs for raw materials and transportation, with the company now expecting to spend $2.3 billion more on freight and commodity costs for its 2022 fiscal year. Despite the price hikes, P&G and grocery chain Albertsons note that consumers have not changed their shopping patterns.

title: P&G’s Global Scale Helping Mitigate Supply Chain Woes
summary: Procter & Gamble (P&G) reported a 4% increase in organic sales for its fiscal first quarter, surpassing expectations, despite facing challenges from rising commodity and supply chain costs. The company is mitigating these issues by raising prices across categories in the U.S. and leveraging its global scale for flexible sourcing and inventory management. P&G's strong e-commerce growth, now representing 14% of total sales, also contributes to its ability to manage supply chain disruptions and optimize costs.

title: Procter & Gamble hikes prices, tries to ease supply chain clogs
summary: Procter & Gamble announced price increases on various home goods due to rising transportation costs and raw material shortages impacting supply chains. The company is implementing strategies like identifying backup suppliers and reformulating products to mitigate inflation and ensure product availability. Other retailers are also getting creative, including chartering their own vessels, to navigate supply chain disruptions and maintain consumer confidence.

title: P&G to increase prices further as commodity, freight costs bite
authors: Uday Sampath Kumar and Siddharth Cavale
summary: Procter & Gamble announced it will further increase prices on some grooming, oral, and skin care products in the U.S. to offset rising commodity and freight costs. These price hikes are in addition to earlier increases on products like Pampers and Always. The company raised its commodity and freight cost impact forecast for the fiscal year to $2.3 billion and expects these additional expenses to reduce full-year earnings per share by 90 cents.

title: The Global Laundry Care Market is expected to grow by $
summary: The global laundry care market is projected to grow by $21.88 billion during 2021-2025, progressing at a CAGR of 4.22%. This growth is attributed to product innovation, portfolio extension, and a shift from traditional laundry care products, as well as improved packaging solutions. The market analysis covers product and distribution channel segments across various geographies and includes a vendor analysis of approximately 25 companies.

title: Why Procter & Gamble Is a Buy
summary: Demitri Kalogeropoulos and Brian Withers discuss why Procter & Gamble (PG) is a manufacturing giant worth investing in due to its competitive advantages, global presence, and strong financial performance. They highlight P&G's market leader position in numerous product categories, efficient manufacturing, innovative packaging, and growing operating profits, making it an attractive stock despite recent market underperformance. The company is a dividend aristocrat with great cash flow and an opportunity to expand margins.

title: P&G Declares Quarterly Dividend, Elects Kempczinski to Board of Directors
summary: Procter & Gamble (P&G) held its 2021 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, where Christopher Kempczinski, President and CEO of McDonald's Corporation, was elected to the Board of Directors along with 11 incumbent directors. Shareholders also passed both Board proposals and the Board declared a quarterly dividend of $0.8698 per share, continuing its 131 consecutive years of dividend payments and 65 consecutive years of dividend increases. CEO David Taylor highlighted the company's strong performance and strategic choices during a challenging year.

title: Outgoing P&G CEO David Taylor cautions 'headwinds will continue;' Peltz leaves board
summary: At his final shareholder meeting as CEO, David Taylor expressed confidence in Procter & Gamble's future while acknowledging ongoing challenges from the pandemic, including rising commodity costs and supply chain issues. P&G posted a $14.3 billion profit on $76.1 billion in sales for the fiscal year, with organic sales up 6%. Nelson Peltz, along with other long-term board members, retired from the board, as Taylor prepares to transition to executive chairman and Jon Moeller takes over as CEO.

title: P&G dogged by controversy on forests, human rights at annual meeting for third year in a row
summary: Environmental advocacy groups protested Procter & Gamble's annual general meeting for the third consecutive year, raising concerns about the company's supply chain issues, particularly its sourcing of pulp from Canadian boreal forests and palm oil from Indonesian and Malaysian tropical forests. Activists called for greater accountability regarding forest destruction, human rights, and climate change, with shareholders voting to keep board member Angela Braly despite pushback. The groups emphasize that pressure on P&G will continue until substantial improvements are made in its sourcing practices and policy.

title: Cottonelle Wipes Maker Inks Deal to End Clogged Sewer Claims in Nationwide Class Action
summary: Kimberly-Clark Corp., maker of Cottonelle wipes, has reached a deal with sewage system operators to address claims that its "flushable" wipes clogged sewers nationwide. The agreement, which has received preliminary judicial approval, mandates that Kimberly-Clark improve product performance and labeling to meet national flushability standards by May 2022. While this settlement resolves injunctive relief claims, it does not preclude claims for damages from other municipalities or defendants in the ongoing lawsuit.

title: Procter & Gamble heirs say company's "production is coming at a terrible price to the planet"
summary: Two sixth-generation descendants of Procter & Gamble co-founder James Gamble, Justine Epstein and Jules Feeney, are pushing the company to adopt more sustainable practices, citing concerns about its environmental impact, particularly its sourcing of wood pulp from Canada's Boreal Forest for products like Charmin. They sent a letter to P&G's CEO, signed by 88 descendants, expressing deep concern about the company's production at a "terrible price to the planet," and advocating for increased use of recycled materials. This pressure follows a shareholder resolution that passed with 67% approval, urging P&G to enhance efforts to eliminate deforestation, despite the company's current stance on needing virgin forest fiber.

title: This Course Lets Undergraduates Act As Brand Managers — And Solve Real Problems
summary: Indiana University's Kelley School of Business offers a Brand Management Practicum where undergraduates work with major companies like Clorox on real-world business problems. This hands-on course, initiated by adjunct lecturer Kelly King, allows students to gain invaluable professional feedback and experience, which helps them secure jobs in the industry. The practicum has grown significantly due to its practical relevance and success in preparing students for careers in brand management.

title: Linda Rendle: age, family, education, salary, career, songs, profiles, net worth
summary: This article profiles Linda Rendle, the first woman CEO of The Clorox Company, detailing her age, education, career progression, and estimated salary. It highlights her journey from a sales analyst to a top executive in a male-dominated field, emphasizing her achievements and recognition as a powerful woman in business.

title: Procter & Gamble's New Storytelling Campaign
summary: Procter & Gamble has reframed its Employee Value Proposition (EVP) to "P&G + Me = Mutual Success," emphasizing the reciprocal relationship between employees and the company. This new EVP, inspired by employee feedback, highlights P&G's commitment to values, superior brands, and a great work environment. The campaign invites employees to share their personal "P&G + Me" stories, illustrating how they have grown and made an impact within the company.

title: Progressive names 3M executive Remi Kent as its new chief marketing officer
summary: Progressive Corp. has appointed Remi Kent, a 3M executive, as its new chief marketing officer, effective Nov. 1, 2021. Kent will succeed long-serving CMO Jeff Charney and will report directly to President and CEO Tricia Griffith. Her appointment comes as Progressive continues to invest heavily in advertising, building on the success of iconic campaigns.

title: Sabir Sami Promoted to KFC Division CEO, Effective January 1, 2022
summary: Yum! Brands, Inc. announced the promotion of Sabir Sami to KFC Division Chief Executive Officer, effective January 1, 2022. Sami, currently KFC Division Chief Operating Officer and Managing Director of KFC Asia, will succeed Tony Lowings, who is retiring. Additionally, Dyke Shipp has been promoted to KFC Division President, reporting to Sami.

title: The Climate Pledge Announces 86 New Signatories, Including Procter & Gamble, HP, and Salesforce, Signaling Their Commitment to Achieving Net-Zero Carbon by 2040 or Sooner.
summary: The Climate Pledge has announced 86 new signatories, including major companies like Procter & Gamble, HP, and Salesforce, bringing the total to over 200 global organizations. These companies commit to achieving net-zero carbon by 2040, a decade ahead of the Paris Agreement, and are collectively expected to mitigate 1.98 billion metric tons of carbon emissions annually by 2040. The announcement emphasizes the urgency of collective action by businesses to address climate change based on recent IPCC findings.

title: From A-choo to A-ha! Unlikely Innovations
summary: This article details the history of Vicks, highlighting its unexpected innovations from its founding in 1894 with VapoRub to more recent developments like Vicks VapoStick and Vicks Ultra Immunity Daily Boost. It emphasizes the role of curiosity and "a-ha" moments in the creation of these products, including the discovery of key ingredients like BB-12® Probiotic and EpiCor®.

title: A Closer Look at P&G’s Net Zero 2040 Ambition
summary: Procter & Gamble (P&G) announced its ambition to achieve net zero greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions across its supply chain and operations by 2040, setting science-based interim targets for 2030. The company's plan outlines efforts to reduce emissions across Scope 1, 2, and 3, primarily cutting most emissions and using natural or technical solutions for residuals. P&G is also addressing emissions in the consumer use phase and committing to transparency in its progress, while working with partners to decarbonize homes and advocate for renewable energy policies.

title: P&G Accelerates Action on Climate Change Toward Net Zero GHG Emissions by 2040
summary: Procter & Gamble (P&G) announced a comprehensive plan to achieve net-zero greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions across its operations and supply chain by 2040, setting interim 2030 goals. The plan includes reducing operational emissions by 50% and supply chain emissions by 40%, with a strong focus on transitioning to renewable electricity, decarbonizing logistics, and developing new low-carbon technologies and materials. P&G also aims to collaborate with consumers and industry partners to reduce emissions from product use and promote sustainable homes.

title: Florida Polytechnic University plans for first tenant in campus research park
summary: Florida Polytechnic University gained approval for its first tenant, International Flavors & Fragrances (IFF), in its campus research park. This public-private partnership will offer internships and job opportunities for students, foster faculty research, and potentially bring significant economic growth to the region. IFF plans to establish a cutting-edge innovation center focused on citrus, leveraging the university's academic expertise.

title: The company behind Tide and Bounty pledges net zero emissions by 2040
summary: Procter & Gamble announced a new climate goal to achieve net zero greenhouse gas emissions across its operations and supply chain by 2040. This plan addresses Scope 3 emissions, which account for about 10 times the company's operational emissions, and includes interim 2030 goals for reductions and efforts to educate consumers on sustainable product use. The company is also working with partners to develop low-carbon technologies and sustainable materials while emphasizing "no deforestation" in its supply chain.

title: ​​Tom’s of Maine False Advertising Claims Dropped As Colgate Exits Class Action Lawsuit
summary: Colgate and lead plaintiff Angela Munsell have ended a class action lawsuit alleging false advertising of Tom’s of Maine brand toothpastes as natural. The lawsuit, originally filed in 2019, claimed the products contained synthetic ingredients despite being marketed as "natural." This dismissal follows a previous settlement where Tom's of Maine agreed to cease "all natural" advertising for three years.

title: Kroger unveils new citrusy shopping cart icon
summary: Kroger has unveiled a new shopping cart-inspired icon featuring a citrusy basket, aligning with its "Fresh for Everyone" slogan and refreshed logo. This new visual aims to create an instant association with freshness for the Kroger Family of Companies. The company also reported Q2 results with a 43% profit drop but raised its annual profit forecast, while its stock saw a 7.5% decline.

title: Commercial Metals Company Announces Appointment Of Gary E. McCullough To Board Of Directors
summary: Commercial Metals Company (NYSE: CMC) announced the appointment of Gary E. McCullough to its Board of Directors, effective October 12, 2021. Mr. McCullough brings over 30 years of business experience, including leadership roles at ARI Packaging, Career Education Corporation, and senior positions at Abbott Laboratories, Wm. Wrigley Jr. Company, and Procter & Gamble. He will serve on the Compensation and Finance Committees, bringing the total number of directors to 10.

title: P&G promotes three women to top executive ranks as new CEO prepares to take over
summary: Procter & Gamble has announced several top executive promotions and retirements as Jon Moeller prepares to take over as CEO on November 1st. In a significant move, three women have been promoted to key leadership roles, potentially positioning them as future CEO candidates for the company, which has never had a female chief executive. These changes involve shifts in leadership for major business units like Family Care, Health Care, and North American operations, impacting divisions responsible for significant portions of P&G's total sales.

title: P&G promotes leaders to key positions
summary: Procter & Gamble has announced key leadership changes, naming Monica Turner as president of its North American business and Carolyn Tastad as CEO of its healthcare division. These promotions highlight P&G's focus on strengthening leadership in its largest and most profitable region and its healthcare sector.

title: Why Procter & Gamble is giving Steve Chabot the cold shoulder
summary: Procter & Gamble has withheld donations to Republican Congressman Steve Chabot's 2022 campaign, a departure from their long-standing support, presumably due to his vote to overturn the 2020 election results. This decision follows a January announcement by P&G to reconsider support for politicians who voted against certifying the election. Chabot's campaign argues that P&G should continue supporting "results-oriented Republican leaders" who advocate for pro-growth policies.

title: Procter & Gamble Taps NFL in Bid to Boost New Tide Habit
summary: Procter & Gamble is partnering with the NFL to promote its "cold water wash" initiative for Tide detergent, aiming to change household laundry habits to save energy and money. Sixteen NFL teams, including the Cincinnati Bengals, will participate by washing their jerseys in cold water with Tide, providing a powerful endorsement for the campaign. This collaboration builds on previous successful advertising partnerships between Tide and the NFL, utilizing traditional TV ads, digital elements, and even sweepstakes with talking washing machines.

title: Yum! Brands Appoints Pizza Hut Division Chief Executive Officer to Drive Global Brand Strategies and Growth
summary: Yum! Brands announced the appointment of Aaron Powell as the global Pizza Hut Division Chief Executive Officer, effective September 20, 2021. Powell, former President of Kimberly-Clark Corporation’s Asia-Pacific Consumer Business, will be responsible for driving Pizza Hut's growth strategies and franchise operations worldwide. This appointment aims to further implement best practices and continue growth for franchisees and shareholders, with Kevin Hochman and Vipul Chawla reporting to Powell.

title: P&G’s Board Must Be Accountable for Forest Destruction
summary: Ten months after Procter & Gamble's shareholders called on the company to address its impacts on climate-critical forests and Indigenous rights, P&G has failed to take meaningful action. This article details P&G's continued role in driving deforestation and human rights violations through its tissue and palm oil supply chains, and calls for investors to hold the Board of Directors accountable by voting against Angela Braly and James McNerney.

title: Powell picked as Pizza Hut’s new CEO
summary: Aaron Powell has been appointed chief executive officer of the global Pizza Hut division at Yum! Brands, Inc., effective Sept. 20. He will oversee Pizza Hut's growth strategies, franchise operations, and performance worldwide. Powell brings over 25 years of experience from Kimberly-Clark Corp. and other companies, specializing in business-to-business and consumer packaged goods sectors.

title: Procter & Gamble has a brand problem
summary: A survey by Fortune and Civis Analytics reveals that Procter & Gamble has a significant generational favorability gap, with only 36% of 18–34 year olds having a favorable view compared to 87% of those over 65. This gap is largely attributed to younger Americans not having heard of P&G, despite the company's efforts in environmental sustainability and its massive advertising budget for individual brands like Tide and Crest. While P&G has the largest net favorability gap, its overall net favorability score remains high at +50 points.

title: Coty Escapes Class Action Claims That it Misled Investors With $12.5 Billion P&G Beauty Deal
summary: Coty and its officers successfully fended off a class action lawsuit alleging they misled investors regarding its $12.5 billion P&G Specialty Beauty Business acquisition. A New York federal court dismissed the amended complaint, finding that shareholders failed to plausibly allege actionable omissions or fraudulent intent concerning integration issues, marketing disclosures, or delayed goodwill impairment. The court sided with Coty, stating the company consistently updated investors on challenges.

title: Procter & Gamble regains its title as top global advertiser
summary: Procter & Gamble has reclaimed its position as the world's top advertiser, surpassing Amazon, with a marketing expenditure of $11.5 billion in its last fiscal year. This resurgence highlights the CPG giant's strategy of maintaining ad spending even during difficult economic times, a move that brand consultants argue has consistently benefited the company. While Amazon has the capacity to increase its ad spending significantly, P&G's continued investment in marketing has proven effective in sustaining its brand presence and sales growth.

title: RPM International names new president of its Consumer Group
summary: RPM International Inc. has appointed Bill Spaulding as the new president of its Consumer Group, effective September 1, succeeding Terry Horan. Concurrently, Jeff Ackerberg will become president of Rust-Oleum, and Mark Heird will take over as president of DAP. These leadership changes involve promoting several veteran executives within RPM's subsidiaries.

title: How I went from chemical engineer to CEO of P&G Beauty
summary: Alex Keith, CEO of Procter & Gamble's Global Beauty business, shares her unconventional career path from chemical engineer to CEO, her experiences leading during a pandemic, and insights on retaining diverse talent. She discusses the importance of mentorship, stepping outside one's comfort zone, and fostering an inclusive culture within a company. Keith also reflects on how her perspective on being over 50 has changed and the lessons she learned about human connection and leadership flexibility during the pandemic.

title: PureCycle technology to head to South Korea
summary: PureCycle Technologies Inc. has signed an MOU with South Korea-based SK Global Chemical to explore building and operating a facility in South Korea to recycle polypropylene scrap into ultra-pure polypropylene resin. This partnership aims to advance plastic circularity in the Asia Pacific region, leveraging PureCycle's solvent-based recycling technology. Both companies express a strong commitment to reducing plastic waste and creating a circular economy for plastics.

title: Procter & Gamble set to dethrone Amazon as world’s biggest advertiser
summary: Procter & Gamble is projected to surpass Amazon as the world's largest advertiser. This report from Ad Age Datacenter indicates a significant shift in global advertising spending.

title: Eastman Enters into Partnership with Procter & Gamble
summary: Eastman and Procter & Gamble have partnered to accelerate the transformation of plastic packaging and collaborate on recycling solutions to enable a circular economy. P&G will integrate Eastman Renew materials, made from molecular recycling technologies using waste plastic, into select products and packaging. The collaboration also aims to expand the collection of hard-to-recycle plastics and drive critical changes in recycling infrastructure.

title: Procter & Gamble’s path to constructive disruption
summary: P&G CEO David Taylor discusses the concept of "constructive disruption" and how it influences the company's innovation, growth, and sustainability strategies. He highlights P&G's efforts in R&D, supply chain resilience, reducing environmental impact through new formulations and packaging, and fostering a culture of passionate collaboration and diversity. The interview also covers challenges in reducing packaging and water usage, along with evolving consumer expectations regarding ESG.

title: Eastman enters into partnership with Procter & Gamble
summary: Procter & Gamble has partnered with Eastman to incorporate Eastman Renew materials into its products and packaging, aiming to reduce reliance on virgin plastics and promote a circular economy. The collaboration will also focus on advocacy and infrastructure development to increase plastic recycling rates, particularly for hard-to-recycle plastics. Eastman plans to open a large molecular recycling facility in 2022 to process over 200 million pounds of plastic scrap annually.

title: P&G’s Taylor Took Home Over $106 Million as CEO
summary: David S. Taylor, CEO of Procter & Gamble, will transition to Executive Chairman of the Board on November 1, 2021, having earned over $106 million in total compensation from 2016 to 2020. Jon R. Moeller will succeed him as President and CEO with an annual target compensation of $16.0 million. This transition marks the departure of the 32nd CEO from the Equilar 500 in 2021.

title: P&G's next CEO is the first with no brand management experience
summary: Jon Moeller will become the first P&G CEO without brand management experience, having risen through the company's financial ranks as CFO for 11 years and COO. Analysts believe his financial acumen is well-suited to navigate current cost pressures from commodities, transportation, logistics, and labor. Despite breaking from tradition, his appointment is seen as a "perfect fit" to continue P&G's strategy of cost-cutting and investment in innovation, which has led to a 75% increase in shares over the last three years.

title: 5 takeaways from P&G's leadership change
summary: Procter & Gamble announced Jon Moeller will become the new CEO in November, replacing David Taylor, who will become executive chairman. This transition is seen as a logical pick for a smooth shift in strategy, given Moeller's extensive involvement in major company decisions over the last decade. The article highlights Moeller's unusual path to CEO through finance, the challenges ahead for P&G including economic uncertainties and potential executive departures, and the concurrent promotion of Shailesh Jejurikar to COO to retain top talent.

title: Vittorio Cretella left school at 17 to join the Italian Army. Now he’s CIO at Procter & Gamble.
summary: Vittorio Cretella, CIO of Procter & Gamble, discusses his unconventional career path from the Italian Army to leading digital transformation at the $300+ billion CPG company. He emphasizes the importance of diversity and inclusion in hiring, along with the pervasive role of digital transformation, machine learning, and cloud adoption in P&G's strategy. Cretella also highlights his work with NPower, a non-profit helping veterans and underserved youth find careers in tech, and P&G's neurodiversity hiring program.

title: P&G names Jon Moeller as CEO replacing David Taylor
summary: Procter & Gamble has announced that Jon Moeller, currently Chief Operating Officer, will take over as CEO on November 1, 2021, replacing David Taylor, who will become executive chairman. Moeller has been with P&G since 1988 and served as CFO for many years, overseeing significant restructuring efforts. Shailesh Jejurikar will succeed Moeller as Chief Operating Officer.

title: Procter & Gamble announces CEO change
summary: Procter & Gamble Co. has announced that Chief Operating Officer Jon Moeller will replace David Taylor as CEO in November. Taylor will continue as executive chairman of P&G’s board, while Moeller's previous role will be filled by Shailesh Jejurikar. This leadership change comes after a period of significant growth and increased shareholder value for P&G.

title: Procter & Gamble CEO David Taylor to Step Aside
summary: Procter & Gamble CEO David Taylor will step down after a six-year tenure, during which he navigated an activist investor, revived sales, and led the company through a pandemic. He will be succeeded by his top deputy, Jon Moeller, on November 1st. Moeller has served as COO for the past two years and was previously the company's finance chief.

title: Jon R. Moeller Elected P&G President and Chief Executive Officer
summary: The Procter & Gamble Company announced that Jon R. Moeller will succeed David Taylor as President and Chief Executive Officer, effective November 1, 2021. David Taylor will transition to Executive Chairman, leading the Board of Directors and advising the CEO. Additionally, Shailesh Jejurikar has been elected Chief Operating Officer, effective October 1, 2021.

title: Strong Leadership to Take P&G Forward
summary: P&G announced significant leadership changes with Jon Moeller elected as President and Chief Executive Officer, effective November 1, 2021, succeeding the current CEO. Shailesh Jejurikar was also elected Chief Operating Officer, effective October 1, 2021. The outgoing CEO will transition to Executive Chairman, supporting the new leadership team.

title: Procter & Gamble names Jon Moeller as new CEO, will replace current chief David Taylor in November
summary: Procter & Gamble announced Jon Moeller will become CEO in November, replacing current chief David Taylor, who will transition to executive chairman. Moeller, currently COO and vice chairman, has been with P&G since 1988. Taylor's leadership saw a proxy battle with investor Nelson Peltz in 2017.

title: Campbell’s commemorates updated soup can labels with NFT collection
summary: Campbell's is launching a 100-piece NFT collection by artist Sophia Chang to celebrate the redesign of its iconic soup can labels. The collection, titled "AmeriCANa — Sophia Chang X Campbell's," will benefit Feeding America, and the brand is partnering with Ntwrk and Aerial to offset the carbon footprint of the NFTs. This initiative ties into current marketing trends by engaging with NFTs, addressing sustainability, and updating the brand's connection to art and popular culture.

title: Focus: Getting the cap on the bottle: Inside P&G's robot ambitions
summary: Procter & Gamble (P&G) is using advanced robotics and automation to maintain its competitive edge in the consumer goods market by reducing manufacturing costs and improving efficiency. Despite being known for branding, P&G develops its own automation solutions, focusing on tasks like precise packaging and handling diverse product shapes. This push for automation is also driven by the need for social distancing during the pandemic and labor shortages, with P&G continuously exploring new robotic applications for its factories.

title: Procter & Gamble: A Force for Good? - The Understory
summary: The Rainforest Action Network critiques Procter & Gamble's environmental and human rights record, highlighting its significant contribution to deforestation through the sourcing of ingredients like palm oil and pulp & paper. The article argues that despite shareholder pressure, P&G lags behind competitors in adopting and implementing No Deforestation, No Peat, No Exploitation (NDPE) policies. It calls for P&G to suspend sourcing from problematic suppliers, respect Indigenous rights, and commit to ending deforestation across its supply chains to become a true "force for good."

title: P&G Declares Quarterly Dividend
summary: The Procter & Gamble Company (NYSE:PG) has declared a quarterly dividend of $0.8698 per share, payable on or after August 16, 2021. This dividend marks 131 consecutive years of payments and 65 consecutive years of dividend increases, showcasing P&G's commitment to returning value to its shareholders. The company serves consumers globally with a strong portfolio of trusted brands across various categories.

title: Be Seen, Be Heard: Driving Visibility of the LGBTQ+ Community
summary: P&G's Global LGBTQ+ Equality Program Leader, Brent Miller, discusses the importance of authentic LGBTQ+ representation in advertising and media to foster equality and inclusion. He highlights P&G's 4R Framework for engaging diverse consumers and their ongoing commitment to LGBTQ+ visibility, including campaigns for brands like Pantene and a partnership with GLAAD for The Visibility Project. The article emphasizes that while progress has been made, continuous effort is needed to ensure meaningful engagement and support for the LGBTQ+ community.

title: Clorox CEO Linda Rendle talks candidly about rising to the top
summary: Clorox CEO Linda Rendle discusses her journey to becoming a chief executive, emphasizing the importance of diverse leadership styles and the support of mentors. She aims to change the narrative of what a CEO should be, highlighting how her introverted nature and active listening skills have been assets. Rendle also shares advice for young women, encouraging them to recognize and leverage their unique strengths.

title: Who was George Cates? Civic leader built a company, helped shape modern Memphis | Evanoff
summary: George E. Cates, a Memphis civic leader and real estate entrepreneur, passed away at age 83. He founded Mid-America Apartment Communities Inc. (MAA), one of the nation's largest apartment owners, and was a significant philanthropist who contributed to the city's growth, including the Grizzlies pro basketball team and the Crosstown Concourse. His legacy extends through his family and the company culture he fostered, emphasizing community and sustainable growth.

title: Digital Watermarking Technology Optimizes Packaging Line Efficiencies at P&G
summary: Procter & Gamble has implemented Digimarc's digital watermarking technology on its Dawn and Fairy liquid soap bottles to enhance packaging line efficiencies and store enterprise data. This technology uses covert codes on labels that can be read by various devices, allowing for faster inspection speeds and reduced camera requirements. The pilot program, conducted across facilities in the Czech Republic, UK, and U.S., demonstrated significant improvements in productivity.

title: Justin Baldoni’s Wayfarer Studios to Launch ‘The Man Enough Podcast’ in Deal With Procter & Gamble (Exclusive)
summary: Justin Baldoni's Wayfarer Studios is launching 'The Man Enough Podcast' next Monday in a significant partnership with Procter & Gamble. This deal also includes P&G co-financing and co-producing other film, TV, and new media projects with Wayfarer Studios. The podcast, inspired by a video series and book, will feature conversations on topics like fatherhood and body image with guests such as Matthew McConaughey and Shawn Mendes.

title: What P&G Can Learn from its Peers
summary: Procter & Gamble (P&G) is criticized for its slow progress in addressing deforestation and intact forest degradation in its supply chain, receiving an 'F' grade from Rainforest Action Network (RAN). The article highlights how other consumer goods giants like Unilever and Mars are implementing more robust sustainability policies, including enhanced traceability, accountability, and commitments to human rights and emissions reduction. P&G is urged to adopt similar practices to catch up with its peers and meet environmental, social, and corporate governance leadership expectations.

title: Procter & Gamble named official presenting sponsor of annual Bayou Classic
summary: Procter & Gamble has been named the Official Presenting Sponsor of the 48th Annual Bayou Classic, extending its corporate partnership agreement with Grambling University Foundation, Inc. and Southern University System Foundation, Inc. This sponsorship, part of a multiyear agreement, allows P&G to further demonstrate its support for Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) and promote its brands through the Bayou Classic's various platforms. The event, ranked as the No. 1 HBCU Classic in the nation, will take place on November 27, 2021, in New Orleans.

title: Amy Chang and Calvin McDonald Elected to The Walt Disney Company Board of Directors
summary: The Walt Disney Company announced the election of Amy Chang and Calvin McDonald to its Board of Directors, effective immediately. Robert A. Iger highlighted their expertise in technology, consumer experience, and scaling businesses. Both Chang and McDonald expressed excitement about contributing to Disney's innovation and growth.
